revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{WikiProject Biography |living=yes |class=B |military-work-group=yes |military-priority=low |listas=Durant, Michael }} {{WikiProject Military history|class=B|B1=yes|B2=yes |B3=yes |B4=yes |B5=yes |Aviation-task-force=yes |US-task-force=yes |Biography=yes }} ==Untitled== Who held Durant prisonner ? Haw was he liberated ? [[User:Ericd|Ericd]] 21:14, 12 Oct 2004 (UTC) Hi. Made a very minor, but one to two years overdue update to page: they have six kids now. Also tried to find template to site his webpage, where it mentions the number of children in his bio, but could not find it. -Genevieve I added his official web page. There's not too much there, but it seemed relevant. I also found his speakers' bureau page [http://www.leadingauthorities.com/21407/Michael_Durant.htm here], if that's of any interest. (Google, as always, is a friend.) --[[User:VAcharon|VAcharon]] 06:16, 24 November 2006 (UTC) == WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Tag & Assess 2008 == Article reassessed and graded as start class. --[[User:Dashiellx|dashiellx]] ([[User talk:Dashiellx|talk]]) 19:01, 16 May 2008 (UTC) == Questions == *After 11 days imprisonment, and pretended to be seriously wounded, how did he survive and how did he recover so remarkably quick? *Was he really shot down, or was it a pilot's fault? *Why did the Somali kill his comrades, but not him? What did he know, or what was his pledge? *There was an Al-Qaeda connection (missing GPS found in Afghanistan), has Durant still connections to the Taleban? --[[Special:Contributions/84.141.21.40|84.141.21.40]] ([[User talk:84.141.21.40|talk]]) 20:49, 4 August 2009 (UTC) He was injured and it took him years to recover, it was not quick. An RPG blew off his tail rotor and that would be fair from pilot error. The somalies were tring to kill him before he was taken as a political prisoner. The GPS did not belong to him the name on it was G. Gordon, and it turn out to have been lost during the Afghanistan war. Also Wiki is not a place to slander people.--[[Special:Contributions/216.211.112.103|216.211.112.103]] ([[User talk:216.211.112.103|talk]]) 18:22, 28 April 2010 (UTC) ==Captivity== Why is the article now saying he was released after five days in captivity? I thought it was eleven days before he was released. - annonymous 6/09/2010 4:43 AM â€”Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/72.71.222.102|72.71.222.102]] ([[User talk:72.71.222.102|talk]]) 08:43, 9 June 2010 (UTC)
